title: London, BL, Add. 17174
Digital Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Library
Lives of the Egyptian Fathers by Palladius, or, as it is here called, "the work of Palladius on the profitable counsels of the holy Fathers."
Part I., in eleven chapters, with an introduction.
Chap. 1. On abandoning the world, on retirement, fasting, and constant dwelling in the cell.
Chap. 2. On fasting, abstinence, and other severities.
Chap. 3. On the reading of the Scriptures, and watching by night, and singing of psalms at the services, and constant prayers.
Chap. 4. That we should weep for our sins, and mourn at all hours.
Chap. 5. On poverty.
Chap. 6. On endurance.
Chap. 7. On obedience to God, and to our fathers and brethren.
Chap. 8. On proper circumspection in our thoughts, words and actions.
Chap. 9. On love and compassion, and the receiving of strangers (or guests).
Chap. 10. On humility, and that a man should despise himself, and deem himself inferior to all men.
Chap. 11. On fornication.
Part II., in 10 chapters.
Chap. 1. That repentance is acceptable, and how we should repent in truth.
Chap. 2. On the workers of miracles.
Chap. 3. On the grandeur of the solitary life.
Chap. 4. Conversations and actions of the saints, and profitable and concise counsels concerning every sort of virtuous deed.
Chap. 5. An encomium on the monks of Egypt, from the commentary of John Chrysostom on the Gospel of S. Matthew, hom. viii.
Chap. 6.
Chap. 7. Another chapter of exhortation of the Fathers.
Chap. 8. A dialogue between a pupil and a teacher.
Chap. 9. Another dialogue, on mental vision.
Chap. 10. Hortatory counsels.

ܐܚܐ ܐܡ̇ܪ. ܐܝ̇ܟܢܐ ܡܬ̣ܩܢܐ ܚܘܒܐ (sic) ܡܢ ܦܘܪ̈ܫܢܐ

otherLimit: ܬܚ̈ܘܝܬܐ ܕܠܚ̈ܡܢ ܠܪ̈ܦܝܐ ܘܠܚܒ̈ܢܢܐ ܘܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܠܐ ܝܨ̇ܦܝܢ ܕܢܦܫܗܘܢ

ܫܠܡܘ ܡ̈ܠ̣ܟܐ ܡ̇ܘܬܪ̈ܢܐ ܘܫ̈ܘܐܠܐ ܘܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓ̈ܡܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܘܝ̈ܚܝܕܝܐ܀ ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܐܒܐ: ܏ܘܫ. ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܟܠ ܕܠܐ̣ܝ ܘܝ̣ܨܦ ܘܟ݁ܢ̣ܫ ܘܣ̣ܡ ܣܝ̣ܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ ܐܝܟ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܢܬܚ̣ܢܢ ܒܪܚܡ̣ܬ̇ ܐܢܫܘܬܗ ܕܝܫܘܥ ܖܐܠܗܐ (sic) ܕܝ̇ܢܐ ܕܚ̈ܝܐ ܘܕܡ̈ܝ̣ܬܐ ܐܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.
ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܡܐܬܝܢ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܒܐܝܪܚ ܬܡܘܙ ܏ܟܗ [ܒܗ ܒܝܘܡ] ܫܒܬܐ ܒܦܠܓܗ ܕܝܘܡܐ ܒܝܘ̈ܡܝ ܛܘܒ̈ܬܢܐ ܘܚ̈ܣܝܐ ܘܪ̈ܝܫܝ ܟܗ̈ܢܐ ܦܐܛܪܝܪ̈ܟܐ ܡܪܝ ܩܘܣ݊ܡܣ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ ܘܡܪܝ ܒ݊ܣܝܠܝܘ݊ܣ . . .
. . ܐ ܚ̇ܛܝܐ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ ܒܫܡܐ ܏ܩܫܝ ܡܢ . . .
ܩ̣ܪܝܬ ܒ̇ܟ̣ܬܒ̇ܐ ܗ̇ܢܐ ܕ݁ܘܝ̣ܕ ܐ̇ܟ̣ܣܢ̣ܝ̇ܐ ܡ̣ܢ ܡܲܪܥ̇ܫ ܐ̇ܬܪܐ ܐܘ ܩ̇ܪܘܼܝܐ ܨ̇ܠܐ ܚ̇ܛܝܘܼܬܝ̣ (sic) ܐܝ̇ܟ ܗ̇ܝܡ̣̇ܢܘܼܬ݂ܝ ܕܒܨ̇ܠܘܼܬܟ. ܘܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܘܿܗܝ ܕܡܪܢ ܢܗ̣ܘ̈ܘܢ ܥܠ ܟܠ̣ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܘܡ̇ܨܠܐ
